solution_line_template: If Julien swam for the whole week, then the total distance in meters that he covered is {julien_daily_distance}*{days_in_week} = <<{julien_daily_distance}*{days_in_week}={julien_weekly_distance}>>{julien_weekly_distance} meters

Sarah swam twice the distance covered by Julien, which is {sarah_multiplier}*{julien_daily_distance} = <<{sarah_multiplier}*{julien_daily_distance}={sarah_daily_distance}>>{sarah_daily_distance} meters
Sarah's total for the whole week is {sarah_daily_distance}*{days_in_week} = <<{sarah_daily_distance}*{days_in_week}={sarah_weekly_distance}>>{sarah_weekly_distance} meters

If Jamir swam {jamir_extra_distance} meters more than Sarah, he covered {sarah_daily_distance}+{jamir_extra_distance} = <<{jamir_extra_distance}+{sarah_daily_distance}={jamir_daily_distance}>>{jamir_daily_distance} meters
Jamir's total for the whole week is {jamir_daily_distance}*{days_in_week} = <<{jamir_daily_distance}*{days_in_week}={jamir_weekly_distance}>>{jamir_weekly_distance} meters

The combined distance for all of them is {jamir_weekly_distance}+{sarah_weekly_distance}+{julien_weekly_distance} = <<{jamir_weekly_distance}+{sarah_weekly_distance}+{julien_weekly_distance}={combined_weekly_distance}>>{combined_weekly_distance} meters
